intro: Grewia hispidissima, commonly known as the rough bush or wild mango, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters tall, characterized by its rough, hairy stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in terminal panicles, followed by small, fleshy berries. Its botanical features include simple, alternate leaves and a fibrous root system, making it adaptable to various soil types. It is often found in coastal and sandy areas, thriving in full sun and well-drained conditions.
